medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was diagnosed with tuberous sclerosis complex (TSC) at age 4 months after presenting with respiratory distress and other symptoms. Over the next 5 years, he's had gradual enlargement of polycystic kidneys with increasing numbers of cysts. At age 7, his renal imaging demonstrated a complex cyst in the lower pole of the left kidney, which had been increasing in complexity and size over time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Tuberous sclerosis complex diagnosed at 4 months of age. History of seizures treated with divalproex sodium, infantile spasms treated with vigabatrin, and hypertension treated with nifedipine and amlodipine.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's father was diagnosed with tuberous sclerosis during adolescence, presenting with renal cysts, hypopigmented macules, and learning disabilities.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lives with his mother and three half-siblings some of the time and with his father the rest of the time. He attends a school for children with special needs.
